definition: to fight a battle/to go to war
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
weaponry/to hold (a weapon)/to wield/to rely on/to depend on/war/battle

sentences.english: The foolish people were clamouring for war .
sentences.chinese: 愚昧的人叫囂着要求打仗。

sentences.english: God often calls surrendered people to do battle on his behalf.
sentences.chinese: 神常常呼召向他委身的人爲他打仗。

sentences.english: When I was of your age， I entered the war.
sentences.chinese: 當我是你這個年齡的時候，我就去打仗了。

sentences.english: The horse is made ready for the day of battle, but victory rests with the Lord .
sentences.chinese: 馬是爲打仗之日預備的，得勝乃在乎耶和華。

sentences.english: Li said that when he spoke he could "raise the dead to fight."
sentences.chinese: 李說他說起話來能“叫死人活過來打仗。”

sentences.english: How can a soldier be expected to fight when he is required to carry several dozen kilogrammes?
sentences.chinese: 現在一個戰士要背幾十公斤，怎麼打仗呀？

sentences.english: So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
sentences.chinese: 大衛既擺陣攻擊亞蘭人，亞蘭人就與他打仗。

sentences.english: How say ye, We are mighty and strong men for the war?
sentences.chinese: 你們怎嗎說，我們是勇士，是有勇力打仗的呢。

sentences.english: Deployment to a foreign country to wage a war entails newness to the nth degree.
sentences.chinese: 部署到外國去打仗導致了他們極大的新奇感。

sentences.english: It seems longer than 35 years ago that the two countries were at war.
sentences.chinese: 這看起來會比35年前兩國打仗會久一點。

sentences.english: But she did not seem to be using it now. She was fighting with her stone knife.
sentences.chinese: 但這會兒她似乎沒使魔杖，她是用石刀在打仗。

sentences.english: We understand the soldiers but not the politics governing the war.
sentences.chinese: 我們瞭解軍人但不知道如何指揮他們打仗。

sentences.english: Japan wants the Philippinos to fight their war against China.
sentences.chinese: 日本想讓菲律賓來替自己和中國打仗。

sentences.english: Now should I keep going or should we call truce?
sentences.chinese: 好了，咁依家我地繼續打仗定系叫返個暫停先呢？

sentences.english: And I think there is a hell-a-lot of difference in training and fighting.
sentences.chinese: 還有我認爲訓練和打仗是差得十萬八千里。

sentences.english: R42/43May cause sensitization by inhalation and skin contact.
sentences.chinese: 吸入及皮膚打仗大概致敏。

definition: to start a war/to open hostilities
weaponry/to hold (a weapon)/to wield/to rely on/to depend on/war/battle
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
to send armed forces to suppress
